page.title: 02HISTERY OF WIDNES
page.content: Until the{1840's Widnes}consisted of four tiny hamlets at{Appleton,Ditton, {Farnworth}and{Widnes Dock.}In{1841}it had a population of{2209.}Most of the land was a wilderness of ferns and brambles.People used to fish or farm. Some made watches or wove canvas. {140}years ago{Spike Island}was lovely. It was the perfect place to go.The{River Mersey}was clean. There was sand and lovely fields. Many factories near Widnes needed {chemicals}called{alkalies.}They made glass in St.Helens.They made soap in Widnes and material near Manchester. There was plenty of land in Widnes to build factories and many people wanted to work in them.{Coal}was available from mines nearby{salt}from Cheshire and{Limestone}from North Wales.There were also good railways and canals to carry goods to and from the factories.
